unit.utterance: Selwan tupaakor nametp̃ag ntau, rato tu teesa tete nanromien ruto nig Apu go Ati negarwes nanromien sees pan tuer kin Ertap.
unit.utterance_translation: When we got to the end of the year we would give the children a present for them to take to their Apu and Ati, a small present they could give to them at Eratap.

unit.utterance: Ntau 1956, komam ramer tuer tete nanromien sees rumer negar wesi pan tuer kin.
unit.utterance_translation: The year 1956, we gave them the small present again for them to give to them.

unit.utterance: Apu ni Elaknar, go Apu nig Elaau rupan tuer kin kailer mai utu.
unit.utterance_translation: Apu from Elaknar and Apu from Elaau they went to give it, then came back.

unit.utterance: Me utol Janweri go komam Limaas ramer nag rakfan saofir.
unit.utterance_translation: After we passed January, and Limaas and I said "Let's go visit them".

unit.utterance: Pastor Kalagis, imurin na komam komau pak Ertap.
unit.utterance_translation: Pastor Kalagis wanted us to go to Eratap.

unit.utterance: Upan paakor Elaknar go Tata Sailas ito esum̃ nega to. Selwan ilek mam
unit.utterance_translation: We went to Elaknar and Tata Sailas was at his house. When he saw us

unit.utterance: go ina, "Webe naik seserik rumai kaifam nafnag wi pan.
unit.utterance_translation: and he said, "Webe, small fish they come and eat all the good food.

unit.utterance: Me tafra rupo inrok mai.
unit.utterance_translation: But the whales will come later.

unit.utterance: Tafra rukfam faat nen ruto me rukmer ler pan."
unit.utterance_translation: The whales eat stones then they return."

unit.utterance: Selwan Paster Kalagis inrog nafsan ni Sailas inrogteesa wes. Me kineu atap nrogteesa wes mau.
unit.utterance_translation: When Pastor Kalagis heard Sailas' talk he felt bad. But I didn't feel bad.

unit.utterance: Atae nag kefo nrik mam ki nap̃et nafsan nag itili. Go ipo nrik mam kin.
unit.utterance_translation: I already knew that he would tell us the meaning of this story that Sailas told us. And then he told us.

unit.utterance: Itili nag naliati iskei naik seserik ruto fam,
unit.utterance_translation: He said one day small fish came would come out to eat

unit.utterance: me tafra ito wat ur elau.
unit.utterance_translation: but the whale was hitting the water (with its tail).

unit.utterance: Me naik seserik runag malfanen elau imu,
unit.utterance_translation: But the small fish said now the tide is high

unit.utterance: tete rukfan tili nag kemai, "Tukmaui en nasusu fam."
unit.utterance_translation: some would go and say he should come." "We will all come and eat at the turn of the tide.

unit.utterance: Selwan elau kemat go kefo mer ler
unit.utterance_translation: When the tide was out and he returned

unit.utterance: go tafra inag, "Iwi akam koen nasusu fam.
unit.utterance_translation: and the whale said, "Okay, you eat on the incoming tide.

unit.utterance: Me kineu kafo mailum net." Naik seserik ruen fam panpan go elau kimat rukoiler.
unit.utterance_translation: I will come later." The small fish lay down and ate and the tide went out and they went back.

unit.utterance: Tafra ipato elau to pulki nam̃elen
unit.utterance_translation: The whale stayed at sea thrashing its tail

unit.utterance: me isok ipturki ntas panpan kaiptol. Go kimro kin nag kefo mer mai fam.
unit.utterance_translation: and jumped and spurted water until it became hungry. And he thought he would go and eat.

unit.utterance: Selwan imai me elau kipe mat ikon kailer.
unit.utterance_translation: When he came and the tide had gone out, he got stuck and went back.

unit.utterance: Or selwan kulefeki Efat negakit, p̃afo lek nasi tafra iuserek nagis negakit nig Efat.
unit.utterance_translation: Okay, when you look around our Efate, you will see whale shit rings the points around Efate.

unit.utterance: Go akit tusoso ki nasi tafra. Natrauswen nig tiawi negakit nig teetwei.
unit.utterance_translation: And we call it whale shit. A story from the old people.
